COMMENT_TX: 1-handed stab $The band struck up and the crowd cheered wildly as Sisler stepped to the plate.
McClellan & Barrett let it fall between them
Crouse threw high, into CF; Mostil fumbled
Squeeze play; Sheely's threw home late
Williams fumbled May have been S7.3-H;2-H(E7)(NR)(UR);B-2
To the flagpole Voigt's only career hit
Lutzke thought the ball would roll foul
Tobin knocked Sewell down on his way to 3B and the easy grounder went for a single.  Speaker's claim of interference was disallowed by Ump Ormsby.
Sewell dropped Stephenson's high toss to 2B
Over LF wall in front of the scoreboard
Speaker coaxed Danforth into a balk by taking a long lead
Lutzke knocked it down then threw to the RF pavilion
Sisler vigorously protested the decision at the plate and the heated argument continued for several minutes.
The Browns swarmed Ump Hildebrand to dispute the decision. He was only saved from violence through the efforts of Severeid and Chet Thomas.
Great catch by Sheely of Kamm's throw
Spectacular catch, colliding with the fence
Slammed against the roof of the RF pavilion
Sheely protested that it was foul
Into RF seats; the crowd went wild
ej,seveh101,P,nalld901,Arguing balls and strikes $Severeid ejected by Ump Nallin for arguing balls & strikes
Fuhr caught Williams off 1B, but when Harris attempted to nail Sisler at 3B, he threw to the LF pavilion.
Caught near a policeman's steed's hind legs
Ladies' Day; most of the spectators were women
Over the top of RF bleachers into the street
Sisler was given a tremendous ovation as he came to bat. Before the game he was honored with a 'diploma' as the 1922 AL MVP.
Hit on the left knee; he writhed in pain and needed several minutes to recover before limping to 1B.
Sisler and Grant collided trying to field the bunt
Hit the top row of seats in RF bleachers
Guessing fielders; Peck was trapped but made it back to 3B.
$Norm McMillan struck on the right hand
$Pat Collins in as a courtesy runner
It began to rain as Goslin came to bat
Rain delay of 3 minutes before Gerber batted.  Play was resumed under threatening skies.
McManus was given a rousing cheer as he came to bat
Just barely cleared RF screen, into bleachers
Great scoop by Sisler of low throw
WashPost reported Goslin stole 2B prior to Ruel's BB
When Hauser threw past 1B trying for the putout, Kolp started for 2B.

umpchange,6,umphome,holmd102 umpchange,6,ump1b,nalld901 umpchange,6,ump3b,(None) $At this juncture, Ump Rowland took off his mask and chest protector and left the field complaining of the heat.  After a delay of several minutes, Ump Holmes took Rowland's place.

ej,austj101,C,holmd102,Balls and strikes ej,sislg101,M,holmd102,Balls and strikes ej,collp101,P,holmd102,Balls and strikes $Sisler engaged in a long debate with Ump Holmes over his balls-and-strikes decisions.  Play was suspended several minutes during the argument, and resulted in the ejection of Sisler & P.Collins. Police were called in when fans resorted to a pop bottle shower.  Jimmie Austin and Holmes went thru all the gesture of a fistic melee, but no blows were struck; Austin was ejected In the near-riot that followed, fans tore down a RF gate; Sisler persuaded them to remain in the stands.  Phil Ball, accompanied by police, confronted Ump Rowland at 3B and a long heated discussion took place.  This caused the fans to throw more pop bottles at Holmes over the Browns' protests. Afterward Sisler aided in the repair of the fallen gate.  As he ran back to the plate he was given a big hand, then he engaged in another verbal combat with Holmes.  Play was finally resumed after a 15-minute delay.
$George Sisler and Pat Collins serving suspensions due to yesterday's ejections.
Williams was called out before Wingard crossed the plate

Holmes took a ball from Davis at Cobb's request and Sisler took after Holmes. Players on both teams crowded around until Ump Nallin decided that Davis was within his rights in rubbing a ball. Play proceeded with Cobb's arguing vigorously with Nallin.
Jacobson received a tremendous ovation coming to bat

A long argument between the Browns and umpires ensued. Apparently Kerr was picked off and called out by Nallin, but Holmes overruled him.  After a 12-minute delay, the umps decided to allow Kerr to return to 1B despite Sisler's disapproval.

Ump Holmes appeared on the field with a swollen eye as a result of the attack made upon him after yesterday's double- header.  The fans got plenty of 'kick' out of jeering him about his black eye as he walked to first base to officiate.
Protest=Y $Game declared no-decision although St. Louis led 10-5; all player records count except no win or loss for pitchers; see detailed comment at end of game
Remarkable 1-handed catch off the LF pavilion
At this stage, Ump Owens warned the Red Sox against their dilatory tactics.
$Sisler and Ump Owens argued whether McMillan or Rego was the hitter in the previous inning.
A long argument followed, the Browns insisted it was foul

$Browns Sisler announced he would protest the game because Ump Owens ruled that Rego should precede McMillan in the batting order in the 9th, which Sisler declared violated the rules.  McMillan had run for Severeid in the 8th, remaining in the game at SS.

At this point the game was interrupted when part of the crowd from the grandstand went down on the field.  After a conference between Mgr Sisler and the umpires it was agreed to put ground rules in force and to allow the overflow on the side lines.
During Meusel's AB, Ump Owens called Danforth off the mound and they engaged in a heated argument over Dave's pitching. Sisler entered the confab and brought it to a close quickly.
Sisler protested vigorously with Ump Owens over the balk
Into RF bleachers, Ruth's 14th HR in July. NY Times reported HR/F7D.
$Ward returned safely to first when pitcher dropped throw in rundown

Between innings, Bush complained to the umpires about the actions of a certain fan behind the Yankee dugout who was directing wild gestures towards Bush.  Bush broke away and headed into the stands after him.  Police, umpires, and players returned Bush to the dugout.  Extra police were rushed in to prevent fans from causing further disorder.
Bush was hissed and jeered as he strutted to the plate.  He took off his cap and made a formal bow to the crowd.
ej,ruthb101,P,rowlp801,Call at 2B $Ruth protested the decision at 2B loudly and was ejected
Weather: heavy morning rain made the outfield soggy but the infield was dry enough.
During Gerber's PA, Schang's pickoff throw to 2B hit Jacobson in the back of the head and he went down under the blow.  After several minutes he was able to resume play.
Ruth let it go through him
Texas Leaguer just out of Peck's reach
Start of game delayed 15 minutes due to rain
Pretty running catch near the stands
Liebold slipped in the heavy going after fielding it
NR?  It's not clear if Jacobson would've scored sans E1
When Mgr Sisler initially sent Evans in, the crowd yelled for Wingard to bat, so Sisler sent Ernie back up.  When Wingard missed the first strike, he was replaced by Evans.
Speaker slipped on the wet turf
Kuhn's ML debut (and only ML appearance)
Sisler collided with Robertson but held on
McManus made a fine stop but threw wild
Stephenson took Uhle's throw but missed 2B on attempted DP
Nice catch; 1st PO by CLE OF
McManus was trapped but made it back to 3B where Jacobson was standing.
1-handed stop by McManus who ran to 1B to make the out
Great catch - Evans climbed RF fence
Clarke was injured trying to get to the ball
$By agreement, Clarke may return to the lineup later in game
Pop fly fell in front of Miller but Infield Fly Rule called
This game was a replay of the July 28th game that was protested by Mgr Sisler.
Gerber dropped the pop fly but Williams got the force.
$Time was called after Tobin collided with Shanks.

After Harris was forced, Sisler muffed Severeid's DP throw to 1B which scored Clark and advanced Ezzell to 3B.  Sisler then threw wild past Severeid, allowing Ezzell to score and Heving to continue to 3B.
ej,robeg101,P,ormsr101,Arguing pickoff call $During Clark's AB, Veach was called safe on an attempted PO3.  Robertson protested and was ejected by Ump Ormsby.
Close play; a long argument followed
Hit & run; Severeid threw his bat at the ball
Over LF wall, landing between the fence and scoreboard
Over LF fence; dropped between short LF fence and the more distant scoreboard.
Bounded past Jacobson to the bleachers
A light rain began to fall as Kolp came to bat
Browns protested that Judge passed Goslin between 3B & home but Umps Owens & Ormsby refused to allow it.
ej,regot101,P,orsmr901,Arguing safe call at home $Late throw home; Rego argued the call and was ejected by Ump Ormsby.
Burke's and Barnhart's ML debut (and only career game)
